methods.addOperation:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Adds an operation for a column.

 
 The add method is used instead of the setOperation(String, AggType, String) method when more than one
 aggregation per input column is desired.

*Overload 1*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - the format string for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (java.lang.String) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - the format string for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (java.lang.String) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
methods.applyToTable:
Helper method for building and applying a totals table to a Table.

:param table: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - The source Table
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) table.setTotalsTable(buildDirective())
methods.buildDirective:
Creates the string directive used to set the Table attribute.

:return: (java.lang.String) the attribute string representing this TotalsTableBuilder.
methods.fromDirective:
Produce a TotalsTableBuilder from a directive string.

 
 The buildDirective() method produces a String representation of a TotalsTableBuilder, this function is
 its inverse.
 

:param directive: (java.lang.String) - the directive.
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) a TotalsTableBuilder
methods.get:
Produce a totals table builder from the source table.

:param source: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the source table
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) a TotalsTableBuilder derived from the source table's totals table attribute
methods.getDefaultOperation:
Gets the operation to use for columns without an operation specified.

:return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) the default operation
methods.getFormats:
Gets the format for an aggregated column.

:param column: (java.lang.String) - the column to get the format for
:return: (java.util.Map<io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType,java.lang.String>) a map from AggType to the corresponding format string
methods.getOperations:
Gets the operations for a given column.

:param column: (java.lang.String) - the column to get the operations for
:return: (java.util.Set<io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType>) a set of aggregations for the column
methods.getShowGrandTotalsByDefault:
Should grand totals be shown by default?

:return: (boolean) true if grand totals should be shown by default
methods.getShowTotalsByDefault:
Should totals be shown by default?

:return: (boolean) true if totals should be shown by default
methods.hasDefinedTotals:
Does a table have a totals table defined?

:param source: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the source table
:return: (boolean) true if source has a totals table defined
methods.makeAggregations:
Produce aggregationsfrom a source table and builder.

:param source: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the source table
:param builder: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) - the TotalsTableBuilder
:return: (java.util.Collection<? extends io.deephaven.api.agg.Aggregation>) the aggregations described by source and builder.
methods.makeTotalsTable:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Create a totals table from a source table.

 
 Given a source table that has had a TotalsTableBuilder applied, create a new totals table from the table. If no
 TotalsTableBuilder has been applied, then the columns are summed.

*Overload 1*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the source table
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) an aggregated totals table
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param source: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the source table
  :param builder: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) - the TotalsTableBuilder
  :param groupByColumns: (java.lang.String...) - the columns to group by
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) an aggregated totals table
methods.operationApplies:
Does the operation apply to type?

:param type: (java.lang.Class) - the column type
:param operation: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the aggregation operation
:return: (boolean) true if the operation is applicable to columns of this type
methods.setDefaultOperation:
Sets the operation for columns which are not otherwise specified.

*Overload 1*  
  :param defaultOperation: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the default operation
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param defaultOperation: (java.lang.String) - the default operation
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
methods.setFormat:
Sets the format of a column.

*Overload 1*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the column to set the format for
  :param agg: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the aggregation type the format is relevant for
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - the format string
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the column to set the format for
  :param agg: (java.lang.String) - the aggregation type the format is relevant for, "*" for all aggregations
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - the format string
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
methods.setOperation:
Sets the operation for a column.

*Overload 1*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - the format string for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder.AggType) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (java.lang.String) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param column: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column to operate on
  :param operation: (java.lang.String) - the aggregation operation for this column
  :param format: (java.lang.String) - the format string for this column
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
methods.setShowGrandTotalsByDefault:
Set whether grand totals are shown by default.

:param showGrandTotalsByDefault: (boolean) - whether grand totals are shown by default
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder
methods.setShowTotalsByDefault:
Set whether totals are shown by default.

:param showTotalsByDefault: (boolean) - whether totals are shown by default
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.util.TotalsTableBuilder) this TotalsTableBuilder

text:
Defines the default aggregations and display for a totals table.

 
 The builder is intended to be used with the applyToTable(Table) method after the operations are applied.
